body:
Please clarify. The code reads as though the delegate should be called five times and then pass, assuming complete accuracy of the timer. However, complete accuracy can't really be assumed and "After" can be even more "after" than you had expected. 

Can you document what actually happens, including timings?

I just tried to run the code in VS and got the following result
```
...
[02/05/2018 20:15:40 Informational] NUnit3TestExecutor converted 1 of 1 NUnit test cases
[02/05/2018 20:15:45 Warning] InComplete
[02/05/2018 20:15:45 Warning] InComplete
[02/05/2018 20:15:50 Warning] InComplete
[02/05/2018 20:15:50 Warning] InComplete
[02/05/2018 20:15:55 Warning] InComplete
[02/05/2018 20:15:55 Warning] InComplete
[02/05/2018 20:15:55 Informational] NUnit Adapter 3.10.0.21: Test execution complete
...
```
I get similar behaviour in the console (I've added the timestamp to the code):
```
...
=> ClassLibrary1.MyTests.TestConstraint
InComplete02/05/2018 20:19:48
InComplete02/05/2018 20:19:48
InComplete02/05/2018 20:19:53
InComplete02/05/2018 20:19:53
InComplete02/05/2018 20:19:58
InComplete02/05/2018 20:19:58
...
```
So the invocations occur in pairs where one would probably expect on call per 5 seconds. I've tried to print the stacktrace from each invocation, but the stacktraces are the same for all 6 invocations
```
[02/05/2018 19:41:25 Warning] InComplete
[02/05/2018 19:41:25 Warning]    at System.Environment.GetStackTrace(Exception e, Boolean needFileInfo)
   at System.Environment.get_StackTrace()
   at ClassLibrary1.MyTests.IsComplete() in C:\Users\Mikkel\Source\Repos\ClassLibrary1\ClassLibrary1\Class1.cs:line 25
   at NUnit.Framework.Constraints.DelayedConstraint.InvokeDelegate[T](ActualValueDelegate`1 del) in C:\src\nunit\nunit\src\NUnitFramework\framework\Constraints\DelayedConstraint.cs:line 356
   at NUnit.Framework.Constraints.DelayedConstraint.ApplyTo[TActual](ActualValueDelegate`1 del) in C:\src\nunit\nunit\src\NUnitFramework\framework\Constraints\DelayedConstraint.cs:line 288
   at NUnit.Framework.Assert.That[TActual](ActualValueDelegate`1 del, IResolveConstraint expr, String message, Object[] args) in C:\src\nunit\nunit\src\NUnitFramework\framework\Assert.That.cs:line 143
   at NUnit.Framework.Assert.That[TActual](ActualValueDelegate`1 del, IResolveConstraint expr) in C:\src\nunit\nunit\src\NUnitFramework\framework\Assert.That.cs:line 127
   at ClassLibrary1.MyTests.TestConstraint() in C:\Users\Mikkel\Source\Repos\ClassLibrary1\ClassLibrary1\Class1.cs:line 19
   at System.RuntimeMethodHandle.InvokeMethod(Object target, Object[] arguments, Signature sig, Boolean constructor)
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeMethodInfo.UnsafeInvokeInternal(Object obj, Object[] parameters, Object[] arguments)
   at System.Reflection.RuntimeMethodInfo.Invoke(Object obj, BindingFlags invokeAttr, Binder binder, Object[] parameters, CultureInfo culture)
   at NUnit.Framework.Internal.Reflect.InvokeMethod(MethodInfo method, Object fixture, Object[] args) in C:\src\nunit\nunit\src\NUnitFramework\framework\Internal\Reflect.cs:line 207
   at NUnit.Framework.Internal.MethodWrapper.Invoke(Object fixture, Object[] args) in C:\src\nunit\nunit\src\NUnitFramework\framework\Internal\MethodWrapper.cs:line 185
   at NUnit.Framework.Internal.Commands.TestMethodCommand.RunNonAsyncTestMethod(TestExecutionContext context) in C:\src\nunit\nunit\src\NUnitFramework\framework\Internal\Commands\TestMethodCommand.cs:line 109
   at NUnit.Framework.Internal.Commands.TestMethodCommand.RunTestMethod(TestExecutionContext context) in C:\src\nunit\nunit\src\NUnitFramework\framework\Internal\Commands\TestMethodCommand.cs:line 81
   at NUnit.Framework.Internal.Commands.TestMethodCommand.Execute(TestExecutionContext context) in C:\src\nunit\nunit\src\NUnitFramework\framework\Internal\Commands\TestMethodCommand.cs:line 64
   at NUnit.Framework.Internal.Execution.SimpleWorkItem.PerformWork() in C:\src\nunit\nunit\src\NUnitFramework\framework\Internal\Execution\SimpleWorkItem.cs:line 59
   at NUnit.Framework.Internal.Execution.WorkItem.RunOnCurrentThread() in C:\src\nunit\nunit\src\NUnitFramework\framework\Internal\Execution\WorkItem.cs:line 510
   at NUnit.Framework.Internal.Execution.WorkItem.Execute() in C:\src\nunit\nunit\src\NUnitFramework\framework\Internal\Execution\WorkItem.cs:line 260
   at NUnit.Framework.Internal.Execution.ParallelWorkItemDispatcher.Dispatch(WorkItem work, ParallelExecutionStrategy strategy) in C:\src\nunit\nunit\src\NUnitFramework\framework\Internal\Execution\ParallelWorkItemDispatcher.cs:line 229
   at NUnit.Framework.Internal.Execution.ParallelWorkItemDispatcher.Dispatch(WorkItem work) in C:\src\nunit\nunit\src\NUnitFramework\framework\Internal\Execution\ParallelWorkItemDispatcher.cs:line 217
   at NUnit.Framework.Internal.Execution.CompositeWorkItem.RunChildren() in C:\src\nunit\nunit\src\NUnitFramework\framework\Internal\Execution\CompositeWorkItem.cs:line 296
   at NUnit.Framework.Internal.Execution.CompositeWorkItem.PerformWork() in C:\src\nunit\nunit\src\NUnitFramework\framework\Internal\Execution\CompositeWorkItem.cs:line 149
   at NUnit.Framework.Internal.Execution.WorkItem.RunOnCurrentThread() in C:\src\nunit\nunit\src\NUnitFramework\framework\Internal\Execution\WorkItem.cs:line 510
   at NUnit.Framework.Internal.Execution.WorkItem.Execute() in C:\src\nunit\nunit\src\NUnitFramework\framework\Internal\Execution\WorkItem.cs:line 260
   at NUnit.Framework.Internal.Execution.TestWorker.TestWorkerThreadProc() in C:\src\nunit\nunit\src\NUnitFramework\framework\Internal\Execution\TestWorker.cs:line 141
   at System.Threading.ThreadHelper.ThreadStart_Context(Object state)
   at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.RunInternal(ExecutionContext executionContext, ContextCallback callback, Object state, Boolean preserveSyncCtx)
   at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.Run(ExecutionContext executionContext, ContextCallback callback, Object state, Boolean preserveSyncCtx)
   at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.Run(ExecutionContext executionContext, ContextCallback callback, Object state)
   at System.Threading.ThreadHelper.ThreadStart()
```

Exactly my findings, I also did an Environment.GetStackTrace(). It seems that two calls are almost executed at the same time. This is just a sample, in my real tests where I wait for results of a longer processing pipeline, I see that the delegate is always executed twice.

The problem is that we are not (re)setting `now` before we are setting `nextPoll` in 255, hence `nextPoll` will every second iteration not be larger than `now`, since `now` is set before the call to `ThreadUtility.BlockingDelay(...)`. A simple attempt where I've added `now = Stopwatch.GetTimestamp();` to the body of the if-statement seems to have corrected the issue.

https://github.com/nunit/nunit/blob/662055f789a8528e851e63c6566822e9392a46d1/src/NUnitFramework/framework/Constraints/DelayedConstraint.cs#L248-L261
@CharliePoole It also took some print-statements to figure out ðŸ˜„ .

I can take a look at this, but I've two questions:
1. Do we have any best practises about writing tests that tests time
2. Is the current behaviour of `PollEvery` correct? That we start by waiting the pooling interval before invoking the method the first time, or should we invoke the method immediately and then wait?

@mikkelbu Look at the existing tests of this constraint.

Waiting before first poll is based on the assumption that the user would not be using After if the action had immediate effect.

@mikkelbu To test time, I'd try to be as integration-like as possible. The thing we have to keep in mind is that the test needs to be resilient in the face of threads being randomly preempted and not getting to execute for two seconds or more. This tends to happen in CI since we're on free shared servers.
NUnit 3.13.2 the problem is reproduced. What about a fix?

issue.title: Throws and Delayed (.After) Constraints do not cooperate, resulting in incorrectly failing test
Fixes #2841
issue.body:
Added fix from @mikkelbu, comment https://github.com/nunit/nunit/issues/2841#issuecomment-386111091  
Added test to verify it

body: @OsirisTerje I guess this is not closed (the label) before the PR is merged ?
